posts.name: Val
posts.cooked: This feels like it wouldn‚Äôt be allowed but I can‚Äôt find the rule in the game manual that would explicitly disallow this. For example: Could you use something like tape to ‚Äúgrab‚Äù onto an algae? If it left residue would that violate the rule around damaging game elements? If so then if it didn‚Äôt leave residue would it be allowed?

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
R206 *Don‚Äôt damage SCORING ELEMENTS. ROBOT elements likely to come in contact with a SCORING ELEMENT shall not pose a significant hazard to the SCORING ELEMENT. SCORING ELEMENTS are expected to undergo a reasonable amount of wear and tear as they are handled by ROBOTS, such as scratching or marking. Gouging, tearing off pieces, or routinely marking SCORING ELEMENTS are violations of this rule.

I can‚Äôt find wording on residue either, which is normally in the manual somewhere

Technically this is about the Cage and less about game pieces, but I think it may still apply.

kingc95:

I can‚Äôt find wording on residue either, which is normally in the manual somewhere

image 1297√ó85 29.6 KB Technically not for adhesives however.

posts.name: Sean Lavery
posts.cooked: Sounds like something you should ask Q&A

posts.name: AfterTen
posts.cooked:
If you could somehow leave absolutely no sticky residue or markings then I can‚Äôt find a rule dis-allowing it.

Residue would violate R206 I think.

posts.name: Pat Mattin
posts.cooked:
I would classify using tape as ‚Äúdubiously legal and probably not too effective.‚Äù Especially given that the tape would likely stick to the textured surface of the algae better than your robot.

At the very least, inspectors may have some questions about whether the tape will come off the robot and contaminate the field. I‚Äôve seen a lot of field tape end up in team‚Äôs swerve modules, preventing them from driving.

posts.name: Gus Michel II
posts.cooked:
AfterTen:

Residue would violate R206 I think.

Agreed. I consider leaving adhesive residue as ‚Äúmarking‚Äù the scoring element.  Something like an anti-slip matt to keep cell phones on the dashboard would be OK.
